story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Sri Lanka, there lived a young boy named Jay. Jay was a curious and adventurous boy who loved to explore the forests and fields surrounding his village.

One day, as the sun began to set and the stars started to twinkle in the night sky, Jay decided to go on a special adventure. He packed a small bag with some snacks and a flashlight, then set off into the forest. The trees whispered with the soft rustle of leaves as Jay walked deeper into the woods.

As Jay journeyed further, he stumbled upon a magical clearing filled with colorful flowers and fireflies dancing in the moonlight. In the center of the clearing, a wise old elephant was sitting peacefully, looking up at the stars above.

The elephant smiled kindly at Jay and beckoned him closer. "Young one," the elephant said, "I am the guardian of this enchanted forest. I have been waiting for someone pure of heart to visit me. You have the spirit of a true adventurer within you."

Jay's eyes widened with wonder as he listened to the elephant's words. The gentle giant continued, "Tonight, I will grant you a special gift. Close your eyes and make a wish from the depths of your heart."

Jay closed his eyes tightly and thought about all the dreams he held dear. He wished for happiness, love, and peace for his family and friends. When he opened his eyes, he saw the sky above him sparkle with a shower of shooting stars.

The elephant touched Jay's forehead with its trunk and whispered, "Your wish has been heard, young Jay. Remember to always be kind, brave, and true to yourself. Your heart holds great power."

Filled with a sense of wonder and gratitude, Jay thanked the elephant and made his way back home, carrying the gift of the forest within his heart.

And so, every night, Jay would look up at the stars and remember the wise old elephant and the magical forest. He knew that as long as he kept his spirit pure and his heart open, he would always be guided by the light of the stars.

As the moon smiled down upon the village, Jay drifted off to sleep, wrapped in the warmth of the night and the love of the enchanted forest.

The end. Goodnight, dear child. Sleep tight and sweet dreams.
